question: 骨折
sourceMnemonic: When your <kanji>bone</kanji> <kanji>break</kanji>s, you end up with, well, a <vocabulary>broken bone</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>fracture</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Just watch out because <ja>こつ</ja> is shortened to <ja>こっ</ja> here.
